computeEnvironmentOrder.description: Details the set of compute environments mapped to a job queue and their order relative to each other. This is one of the parameters used by the job scheduler to determine which compute environment should execute a given job.

jobQueue.description: The name or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the job queue.

priority.description: The priority of the job queue. Job queues with a higher priority (or a lower integer value for the priority parameter) are evaluated first when associated with same compute environment. Priority is determined in ascending order, for example, a job queue with a priority value of 1 is given scheduling preference over a job queue with a priority value of 10.

state.description: Describes the queue's ability to accept new jobs.
